comments.body:
nit:It probably does not matter too much for the test, but could we change the input to be 2 tensors of shape(-1,2) instead of (-1, 4) and pass the first 2 columns of the dataframe as input_a and the second 2 as tensor_b?

That way the model should look the same as in other case and it may be easier to check / reason about it if something goes wrong.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +44,48 @@@pytest.fixture(scope="module")
def multi_tensor_input_model(data):
    x, y = data
    input_a = Input(shape=(2,), name="a")
    input_b = Input(shape=(2,), name="b")
